physical_examinations.vital_signs: Tachycardia with heart rate in the low 100s
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Febrile state two weeks after initiation of clozapine treatment. Eosinophilia with eosinophil counts of 2.7 × 10^9/liter, 23% of total WBC count, and later 2.8 × 10^9/liter, 27% of total WBC count.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eosinophilia persisted, requiring cardiac workup including enzyme levels and echocardiogram, which showed no evidence of myocarditis.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: WBC count of 6.9 × 10^9/liter, 0% eosinophils upon emergency department assessment
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physically asymptomatic with normal laboratory values, including liver function tests.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Discharged with normal eosinophil count of 3.4 × 10^8/liter (5% of total WBC count) and all other lab values within normal limits.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Extreme poor eye contact and flat affect upon admission; guarded with curt responses.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improved eye contact and mood, engaged more with staff and other patients over time, indicating improvement in affect.
